questions.question: …………………. a loud noise, the thief ran away.
He is ……………….. fat to run fast.

questions.description: Although is used to connect two contrasting ideas.

questions.question: Vicky ……………….. was once my student is now an acclaimed writer.
questions.description: That cannot be used to refer to people in non-identifying relative clauses.

questions.question: ………………… being faster, the hare could not beat the tortoise in the race.
questions.description: We use a preposition before an ing form.

questions.question: …………………… hard you may work, you cannot beat him.
questions.description: However means the same as no matter how.

questions.question: 7……………………… his poor health, he still goes to work regularly.
questions.description: Either despite or in spite of can be used here.

questions.question: ………………… you hurry up, you will miss the train.
questions.description: Unless is similar to if not.

questions.question: The faster you run, ………………….. you get tired.
questions.description: In this structure, the + comparative is used in both clauses.
